com.blueradios
Class Brsp

java.lang.Object
  com.blueradios.Brsp

public class Brsp
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides support for the BlueRadios Serial Port (BRSP) service on AT.s modules. Each instance communicates with one BLE peripheral at a time. View this README for important information and limitations before using this API.

Constructor Detail

Brsp

public Brsp(BrspCallback callback)
Base constructor. Buffer sizes will be set to 1024

Parameters:
callback - BrspCallback object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an callback is null

Brsp

public Brsp(BrspCallback callback,
            int inputBufferSize,
            int outputBufferSize)
Constructor with optional parameters to set buffer sizes. Note: If either buffer is 0 or negative, it will be set to the default size of 1024

Parameters:
callback - BrspCallback object
inputBufferSize - Size in bytes for the input buffer
outputBufferSize - Size in bytes for the output buffer
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an callback is null
Method Detail

isSending

public boolean isSending()
True if sending data to remote device

Returns:
true if output buffer is not empty

getLastRssi

public int getLastRssi()
The last rssi value

Returns:
The last RSSI returned by a call to readRssi(). Will be 0 if a read was not performed during a connection

getConnectionState

public int getConnectionState()
Returns the BluetoothGatt state of the remote device

Returns:
The BluetoothGatt current connection state

getBrspState

public int getBrspState()
Gets the current state of the BRSP service. If BRSP_STATE_READY the service is ready for sending and receiving.

Returns:
BRSP_STATE_READY or BRSP_STATE_NOT_READY

setBrspMode

public boolean setBrspMode(int mode)
Changes the BRSP mode of the remote device.

Parameters:
mode - The new mode. Currently supports BRSP_MODE_DATA and BRSP_MODE_COMMAND
Returns:
true if a successful write request was sent.

getBrspMode

public int getBrspMode()
Gets the current BRSP mode

Returns:
The current BRSP mode. Currently supports BRSP_MODE_DATA and BRSP_MODE_COMMAND

getDevice

public BluetoothDevice getDevice()
Gets the current remote device

Returns:
The current BluetoothDevice. Null if connect was never called with a valid device

getInputBufferSize

public int getInputBufferSize()
The total capacity of the buffer

Returns:
Total InputBuffer capacity this object was created with. Note: This can not be changed after instantiation.

getOutputBufferSize

public int getOutputBufferSize()
The total capacity of the buffer

Returns:
Total OutputBuffer capacity this object was created with. Note: This can not be changed after instantiation.

getInputBufferCount

public int getInputBufferCount()
The amount of bytes currently in the buffer

Returns:
Number of bytes in the InputBuffer

getOutputBufferCount

public int getOutputBufferCount()
The amount of bytes currently in the buffer

Returns:
Number of bytes in the OutputBuffer

intputBufferAvailableBytes

public int intputBufferAvailableBytes()
Bytes available before buffer is full

Returns:
Number of bytes left that can be retrieved from device

outputBufferAvailableBytes

public int outputBufferAvailableBytes()
Bytes available before buffer is full

Returns:
Number of bytes left that can be written via writes

clearInputBuffer

public void clearInputBuffer()
Atomically removes all of the elements from the input buffer. The buffer will be empty after this call returns.

clearOutputBuffer

public void clearOutputBuffer()
Atomically removes all of the elements from the output buffer. The buffer will be empty after this call returns.

readBytes

public byte[] readBytes()
Retrieves and removes all bytes in the input buffer.

Returns:
All bytes in the input buffer. Will return null if input buffer is empty.

readBytes

public byte[] readBytes(int byteCount)
Retrieves and removes specified number of bytes from the buffer.

Returns:
Specified amount of bytes. If byteCount < 1 will return null. If byteCount greater than bufferCount, will return all bytes.

writeBytesObj

public void writeBytesObj(java.lang.Byte[] bytes)
Queues up bytes and sends them to the remote device FIFO order

Parameters:
bytes - Bytes to send

writeBytes

public void writeBytes(byte[] bytes)
Queues up bytes and sends them to the remote device FIFO order

Parameters:
bytes - Bytes to send

connect

public boolean connect(Context context,
                       BluetoothDevice device)
Connects to the remote device and initializes the BRSP service

Parameters:
context - Context this object is associated with. (The Application Context is recommended)
device - BluetoothDevice to connect to
Returns:
true if connection attempt was successful
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an argument is null
See Also:
BrspCallback.onConnectionStateChanged(Brsp), BrspCallback.onBrspStateChanged(Brsp)

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnects from the remote device.

readRssi

public void readRssi()
Read the RSSI for the remote device. Will fire BrspCallback.onRssiUpdate(Brsp)

See Also:
getLastRssi()

close

public void close()
